properties.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 2:02PM MST until February 4 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE NORTH CENTRAL AREA...

.A storm system will bring wintry weather to the Tusas, Jemez and
the higher peaks of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Upper Rio
Grande Valley starting tonight and continuing through Tuesday. Up
to 8 inches of snowfall is possible across the peaks and west
facing slopes while up to 4 inches could fall in the high valleys.
Roadways will become snowpacked and icy especially in the
mountains.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches
in the Upper Rio Grande Valley and up to 8 inches on the
mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Jemez Mountains, Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains,
Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Upper Rio Grande
Valley.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing snow
may reduce visibility below 2 miles.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY
